trans-unit.target: TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_SEQ_00<tab>Fremondain seems a bit more driven than normal.

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_SEQ_01<tab>It transpires that Fremondain wishes his mistress to wield Integrity, the sword of House Jervaint, her birthright, in the final round of the grand tourney. As you might predict, however, it is not in the right state. It has rusted through and is nigh unusable. Thus, Fremondain asks you to consult with Forgemaster Brithael to discover a way to restore the once-mighty blade.

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_SEQ_02<tab>Forgemaster Brithael is glad to see his favorite smithy, and shocked to learn you have not earned enough for a tankard of ale from House Jervaint. Yet, he reasons, a blacksmith's fame is tied to the heroes who wield his creations, and encourages you to continue with Baroness Laurisse for that reason alone. Moving along, he pronounces restoring Integrity to be beyond his skill. However, a certain fellow named Gerolt may be able to help. Make your way to Hyrstmill and consult with Eorzea's preeminent weaponsmith.

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_SEQ_03<tab>You attempt to show Integrity to Gerolt, who yells at you to either go away or take it up with Drake. The apprentice himself is eager to help, but lacks the skill. He believes he can yet persuade his master, but Gerolt's services will come at a cost─a high-quality titanium lump hammer. Apparently, the legendary smith's displeasure stems from the loss of his own tool to moneylenders. Aid the apprentice.
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_SEQ_04<tab>After admiring your handiwork, and offering praise for the hammer, Drake bids you speak again with Gerolt. His master ought to be more welcoming, he says.

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_SEQ_05<tab>While “welcoming” might be a stretch, Gerolt nevertheless looks at Integrity. Though he is quick to praise its construction─it being of fine adamantite, made pure by some ancient technique─he also says it is impossible to repair. However, there is a ray of hope; the sword's hilt holds the remains of some Ishgardian saint, and from this hallowed bone does the blade's power stem. It could be remade if you forge an adamantite winglet of the same shape, size, and quality as the original, and then transfer the reliquary to your creation. Return now to Fremondain at the Jeweled Crozier, and tell him of this interesting development.

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_SEQ_06<tab>You return Integrity to Fremondain, and reveal all you have learned. Although surprised, the steward nevertheless takes it in stride, and wonders aloud if the bone inside the original sword is that of Saint Finnea. He leaves you with a single thought: now that the final round of the grand tournament nears, perhaps a new blade will give Baroness Laurisse the edge she needs.
※The next blacksmith quest will be available from Fremondain upon reaching level 60.

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_FREMONDAIN_000_000<tab>Ah, just the blacksmith I needed!

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_FREMONDAIN_000_001<tab>As you know, milady's turn in the final round of the tourney draws near. It is my wish that she wield her birthright─Integrity, the sword of House Jervaint.

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_FREMONDAIN_000_002<tab>The blade has graced the hands of her forebears in countless battles. Now... Well, suffice it to say it requires a <var 1A 02 /var>most<var 1A 01 /var> thorough restoration.

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_FREMONDAIN_000_003<tab>I have made inquiries with Master Brithael. He may be able to help, but he also made mention of needing to see the sword in person. Would you be so good as to take it to your guildmaster?
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_FREMONDAIN_000_010<tab>Has Master Brithael conceived of a means to fix Integrity?

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_BRITHAEL_000_030<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! I was jus' wonderin' when me favorite <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>'d show up. Did ye bring Integrity, or whatever House Jervint─er, Jervont was callin' it?
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_BRITHAEL_000_034<tab>Hmmm... This was a fine blade once. But now, it'd be easier to make it into a butter knife than a sword. What's their reason fer wantin' it fixed?

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_BRITHAEL_000_035<tab>Bleedin' hells, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, they want it fer the <var 1A 02 /var>grand tourney<var 1A 01 /var>? And yer not makin' a single gil from this? By the Twelve, what'd I get ye into!?

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_BRITHAEL_000_036<tab>...Still, it might pay off in the end. Heroes climb to fame on the backs o' smitties, but the opposite's true, too─<var 1A 02 /var>you'll<var 1A 01 /var> be famous if some champion is wieldin' one o' yer blades.
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_BRITHAEL_000_037<tab>An' this Laurisse sounds like she's got the right stuff. True o' heart, cares fer the people, resolves to be a leader, an' so on.

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_BRITHAEL_000_038<tab>'Course, she'll want fer a little temperin'. But stick together, an' ye'll both reach new heights. Matter o' fact, I think there ain't no better opportunity fer ye as a smitty!

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_BRITHAEL_000_039<tab>Anyroad, the sword is damaged beyond what I can repair. But have ye ever heard of a bloke named Gerolt? A weaponsmith, livin' out in Hyrstmill? Well, word is he's second only to the Builder when it comes to restorin' arms!
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_BRITHAEL_000_040<tab>If there's any in the realm who can fix this sword, 'tis he.
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_BRITHAEL_000_050<tab>Strange place to live, Hyrstmill. Got to wonder why this Gerolt bloke chose it...
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_BRITHAEL_000_051<tab>Anyroad, he's the one to see about yer Integrity. The sword, not yer <var 1A 02 /var>actual<var 1A 01 /var>...
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_GEROLT_000_80<tab>What!? What nuisance have ye come to drop on me anvil!?

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_GEROLT_000_90<tab>That soddin' hunk o' rust!? I ain't touchin' nothin' that ain't kettle shaped for the next <var 1A 02 /var>moon<var 1A 01 /var> at this rate, what with all the orders I got. Drake! Deal with this!
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_DRAKE_000_91<tab>Please, <var 08 E905 ((madam)) ((sir)) /var>, forgive my master. Is there anything I might help you with?
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_DRAKE_000_92<tab>Hmmm... I'm afraid that even with my experience, I do not know how to restore this.

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_DRAKE_000_93<tab>But there is a chance my master might...if he'd calm down enough to listen, anyway. I think we might yet enlist his aid, but it might require some elbow grease on your part.

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_DRAKE_000_94<tab>Moneylenders recently took my master's favorite titanium lump hammer. If you were to make him a new one just as fine, it might improve his disposition. At the very least, he might stop throwing half-finished kettles at me.
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_DRAKE_000_110<tab>Have you made a replacement titanium lump hammer, <var 08 E905 ((madam)) ((sir)) /var>?
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_DRAKE_000_120<tab>My, you clearly made this hammer with the smith in mind. It seems perfectly suited to delicate work. My master will fashion some fine kettles with this!
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_DRAKE_000_121<tab>Thank you for your efforts. I believe that with this, Gerolt will be more willing to hear out your request.
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_GEROLT_000_140<tab>Aye, I heard what ye did fer me. So come on, show me the sword. Now! I ain't got all bloody day!

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_GEROLT_000_150<tab>If I ain't mistaken─an' I rarely am─this is an adamantite blade. Pure, too... Whatever smeltin' technique the ancients used got it purer than most modern smitties could. An' yer askin' if it can be made battle ready again?
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_GEROLT_000_151<tab>I'm afraid it ain't possible, <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>. Can't be done with that sword, an' that's that.

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_GEROLT_000_152<tab>But don't toss it jus' yet. The hilt's special─a reliquary. ...Means there's a saint's bone or summat inside. Reckon this sword is a treasure <var 1A 02 /var>because<var 1A 01 /var> o' that.
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_GEROLT_000_153<tab>So, what happens if ye forge an adamantite winglet in the exact shape an' size as the original an' enshrine the saint's remains in that?
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_GEROLT_100_153<tab>Aye, <var 1A 02 /var>that's<var 1A 01 /var> what ye'll have to do to remake this Integrity!
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_FREMONDAIN_000_190<tab>Have you found a means to repair Integrity, <var 08 E905 ((Mistress)) ((Master)) /var> <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 03 /var>?
TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_FREMONDAIN_000_200<tab>Repairs are out of the question, then? Hmmm. I believe the bone in the hilt is Saint Finnea's. It was rumored that House Jervaint owned such a reliquary.

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_FREMONDAIN_000_201<tab>Well, if the soul of the original can be passed to a new blade, then the sword must be remade. I daresay milady's ancestors would find no fault in us for doing so!

TEXT_CLSBSM580_02010_FREMONDAIN_000_202<tab>My mistress can use Saint Finnea's spirit in the final bout of the tourney. Come, <var 08 E905 ((Mistress)) ((Master)) /var> <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 03 /var>, let us forge her birthright anew!
